rdf-ext-menu.alert-no-align: You haven't done any RDF schema alignment yet!
rdf-ext-menu.set-up-service: Set up a new reconciliation service that uses
rdf-ext-menu.search-single-site: to search on a single site
rdf-ext-menu.alert-label-provided: At least one label property should  be provided
rdf-ext-menu.alert-rdf-error: There was an error while uploading RDF dump
rdf-ext-menu.based-sindice: Based on a Sindice site search
rdf-ext-menu.based-entityhub: Based on a Apache Stanbol EntityHub

rdf-ext-schema.alert-shared: All rows will point to a shared blank node
rdf-ext-schema.alert-literal: All rows will have the literal
rdf-ext-schema.alert-resource: All rows will have the resource
rdf-ext-schema.alert-blank-create: A blank node will be created per row
rdf-ext-schema.resolve: relative URIs will be resolved against base URI
rdf-ext-schema.unknown-pref: is unknown prefix. Enter the full URI below to add it.
rdf-ext-schema.confirm-one: Base URI should end with a fragment identifier - either / or # .
rdf-ext-schema.confirm-two: Do you want to keep this URI anyway? It might not be displayed correctly.
rdf-ext-schema.no-matches: No suggested matches. (Shift + Enter) to add it

rdf-ext-stanbol.subheader: This allows you to register new reconciliation services based on Apache Stanbol's EntityHub.
rdf-ext-stanbol.help: So you'd just need to know the URI where Stanbol is running with the necessary indexes for your concrete data, and this process will automatically fetch and register all available reconciliation services.

rdf-ext-rdf.desc: This will set up a new reconciliation service based on an RDF file that provides entity URIs and entity labels.
rdf-ext-rdf.name: Name
rdf-ext-rdf.detail: A human readable name for reconciliation service
rdf-ext-rdf.imp-desc: Select properties that are used to label resources in the RDF data. Selecting other labels may affect performance. These properties will be used to match resources
rdf-ext-rdf.full-uri: Full URIs; separate multiple URIs with whitespace

rdf-ext-sparql.name: Name
rdf-ext-sparql.graph-desc: Leave empty to use the default graph
rdf-ext-sparql.det-syntax: This determines the syntax that will be used for search
rdf-ext-sparql.prop-desc: Select properties that are used to label resources in the endpoint. These properties will be used to match resources
rdf-ext-sparql.full-uri: Full URIs; separate multiple URIs with whitespace

rdf-ext-prefix.fetch: Try fetching vocabulary terms from the Web
rdf-ext-prefix.imp: Import vocabulary terms from a file

rdf-ext-align.desc: The RDF schema alignment skeleton below specifies how the RDF data that will get generated from your grid-shaped data. The cells in each record of your data will get placed into nodes within the skeleton. Configure the skeleton by specifying which column to substitute into which node.
rdf-ext-align.sample-turtle: This is a sample Turtle representation of (up-to) the first 10 rows

rdf-ext-vocab.schema-vocab-desc-one: This will re-fetch the vocabulary from
rdf-ext-vocab.schema-vocab-desc-two: If you added it by uploading a file you need to delete it and add it again to refresh the index. Continue?

rdf-ext-sindice.find-related: Finding related RDF datasets...(This could take up to 5 minutes)
rdf-ext-sindice.sel-domain: a domain needs to be selected
